etymology.description: Pictogram: a horse with head facing left and flowing mane; in bronze, the head simplified to 目; legs evolved into four dots 灬 (unrelated to 火). Simplified 马 from 馬 via cursive script.
etymology.interpretation: Originally a sketch of a horse that gradually stylized its head and legs into simple strokes. Modern simplification to 马 follows a cursive handwriting form, compressing the body and abstracting the legs into a single sweeping shape.
etymology.simplification: Reduced from 馬 based on cursive (草书) form to speed writing, cutting strokes from about 10 to 3 and standardized in the PRC.

examples.chinese: 那匹马跑得很快(那匹馬跑得很快)。
examples.pinyin: Nà pǐ mǎ pǎo de hěn kuài.

examples.chinese: 他骑马去学校(他騎馬去學校)。
examples.english: He rides a horse to school.

examples.chinese: 马上开始比赛(馬上開始比賽)。
examples.english: The competition will start right away.
